H0.text: Lake is the type of ecosystem that has the greatest variation in temperature from its top to its bottom.

H1.text: Pond ecosystems exhibit the greatest variation in temperature from their top to bottom.

H2.text: Ocean is the ecosystem that has the greatest variation in temperature from its top to its bottom.

H3.text: Estuary is the type of ecosystem that has the greatest variation in temperature from its top to its bottom.

A4.text: In a holomictic lake, the uniformity of temperature and density allows the lake waters to completely mix.

A5.text: As the summer begins, two distinct layers become established, with such a large temperature difference between them that they remain stratified.

A6.text: Shallow ponds often have a continuous temperature gradient from warmer waters at the surface to cooler waters at the bottom.
